title: git-credential interfaces (datalad's in Git and vice versa)

labels.name: minor
labels.description: Increment the minor version when merged

body:
Towards #5028

### Provide `git-credential-datalad`
A credential helper that can be used to query datalad credentials
directly in Git

Demo:

```
% echo 'url=http://example.com/mike\nusername=dummy\npassword=mike' \
    | git -c credential.helper=datalad -c credential.useHttpPath=1 \
        credential approve
% echo url=http://example.com/mike \
    | git -c credential.helper=datalad -c credential.useHttpPath=1 \
        credential fill
protocol=http
host=example.com
path=mike
username=dummy
password=mike
% echo url=http://example.com/mike \
    | git -c credential.helper=datalad -c credential.useHttpPath=1 \
        credential reject
% echo url=http://example.com/mike \
    | git -c credential.helper=datalad -c credential.useHttpPath=1 \
        credential fill
Username for 'http://example.com/mike':
...
```

### Provide `GitCredential` -- wrapper for `git credential`

```py
>>> from datalad.local.gitcredential import GitCredential

>>> GitCredential(url='http://example.com/mike').fill()
Username for 'http://example.com':
<Ctrl-C>

>>> GitCredential(
...    url='http://example.com/mike',
...    username='mike',
...    password='nomike').approve()

>>> GitCredential(url='http://example.com/mike').fill()
{'protocol': 'http', 'host': 'example.com', 'username': 'mike', 'password': 'nomike'}

>>> GitCredential(url='http://example.com/mike').reject()
```
